basics.name: Lara Karki
basics.label: she/her
Human-Centered AI Ph.D. Research Intern
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate researching AI's impact on work. Hybrid background in art, software engineering, and social science research enables translation across technical teams, business units, and end users to align stakeholder needs and deliver value through innovation, efficiency, and adoption.

highlights: AI Integration & Strategy: Developed internal framework to drive AI transformation across domains through human-centered approaches, identifying four key opportunities to unlock value: adoption, user empowerment, human-AI collaboration, and governance. Created actionable research agendas prioritized by business impact and presented to AI leadership teams across Merck divisions (Human Health, Animal Health and R&D).

Research Design: Designed and conducted applied research through ethnographic observation and interviews with 25+ stakeholders including product designers, data scientists, analysts, leadership, and sales management across business units. Identified adoption bottlenecks as a primary business challenge; translated findings into additional targeted research protocols and frameworks.

AI Product Enablement: Improved adoption of new Gen AI product to enhance field sales reps' customer engagement by developing research protocols to understand pain points and opportunities in current workflows. Identified user segments through surveys, assessed AI impact on work practices, and proposed design solutions to maximize adoption and scalability.

Stakeholder Communication: Summarized, extracted and presented key insights from my academic research on human-AI collaboration to a broader internal audience. Delivered several presentations to the AI Leadership Team and internal Responsible AI group of 100+, facilitating cross-functional knowledge sharing.

work.company: DataWorks at Georgia Institute of Technology
highlights: AI Impact & Workforce Transformation: Contributed to work-based training/reskilling program addressing emergent needs for middle-skill data work resulting from AI/ML technologies. Integrated data ethics and computing literacy into technical skill development and work practices. Program's demonstrated value led to institutional adoption, evolving from research initiative to a permanent department within Georgia Tech.

Problem-Solving & Collaboration: Identified training gap through ethnographic observation and survey research. Designed and implemented curriculum addressing job search challenges, increasing employment outcomes by 50% through targeted skill development interventions and creating novel professional development opportunities in technology careers.

Research & Analysis: Designed user study to uncover technical platform barriers preventing participants from completing key tasks. Formed research teams with program participants as co-researchers, increasing rigor by incorporating stakeholder perspectives and developing solutions to platform shortcomings.

Applied Research & Stakeholder Engagement: Conducted survey and interview study with 15+ stakeholders across product, design, and engineering to assess alignment issues. Identified business need to improve customer experience through more reliable user interface development, faster replatforms, and enhanced cross-functional communication.

Innovation & Efficiency: Prototyped technical solution leveraging emerging web technologies; solution adopted in production across 25+ brands, increasing productivity for brand migrations by 60%, enabling rapid response to stakeholder requests, and creating more reliable user experiences.

Communication & Collaboration Tools: Implemented change management through documentation, training, and communication channels supporting adoption across 80-person product and engineering department. Collaboration tools created shared language enabling stakeholder alignment and value creation.

Entrepreneurship & Strategy: Built and managed independent consulting business, providing end-to-end branding, design, development, and strategy services to 30+ clients including The Weather Channel, Barnes and Noble, web development agencies, startups, and small businesses.

Interactive Prototyping: Founding instructor of UI/UX continuing education certificate program, developing two courses in 'Prototyping in Code,' teaching programming fundamentals and technical communication to 12-15 non-technical professionals per cohort from corporate backgrounds.

Executive Communication: Facilitated 'Code in a Day' workshops for non-technical executives, improving their technical communication and understanding of modern development concepts. Provided individualized support adapting curriculum to executives' specific business contexts and communication needs.
Presented research at academic conferences (e.g., ACM Computer Supported Cooperative Work), communicating findings across disciplines

Promoted novel and emerging development approaches with presentations delivered at 19 industry conferences to audiences of 500+ attendees; recorded talks have 40k+ views and invited guest on 5 podcasts

volunteer.position: Mentor, Community Organizer, & Open Source Contributor
highlights: Co-founded mentorship program pairing senior PhD students with junior PhD students in computing
Founded and co-organized ongoing developer meetups and conferences providing vital community support.
Contributed to WordPress Core open-source project, contributing code, facilitating and organizing team meetings, and presenting at conferences and meetups.

highlights: Coursework: Prototyping Interactive Systems, Research Methods, Issues in Human-Centered Computing, Learning & Development, Social Studies of Technology, Future of Work
Dissertation: "The Search for Tech-Related Admin Jobs in Times of Technological Change"

education.company: School of the Museum of Fine Arts at Tufts University
highlights: Coursework: Animation, Painting, Printmaking and Bookmaking, Game Design; Programming (Self-Directed)

skills: AI Integration & Transformation: AI/ML product design & development, human-AI collaboration, responsible AI, adoption strategies, workforce impacts, work practices integration, organizational change management, upskilling/reskilling
Research & Analytics: Applied research methods, ethnography, interviews and surveys, qualitative/quantitative analysis, mixed-methods, impact evaluation, rapid prototyping, user research and testing

Development & Software: Full-stack web engineering (PHP, Enterprise WordPress, JS, React, HTML/CSS), software architecture (design systems, MVC), software testing and CI/CD, Python (pandas, matplotlib), UI/UX design, LLMs (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini), Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), qualitative analysis software (Dovetail, MAXQDA), Adobe Creative Suite
